the irregular motion of waves (usually caused by wind blowing in a direction opposite to the tide)
the yield from plants in a single growing season
the 17th letter of the Greek alphabet
A Hebrew measure of capacity; a core or homer.
Any of several large, ferocious sea creatures, now especially the killer whale .
an athlete who plays for pay
mythical bird of prey having enormous size and strength
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a midwestern state in north central United States in the Great Lakes region
op Op art ; a style of abstract art.
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
